result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy J Brickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Disclose Rec. Manuf'r<100 (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.209(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
--------------------------------

No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Any prescription medications to be made known to Agent and taken as prescribed.
--------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
--------------------------------

timeConds.notes: Complete forty (40) hours of community service work during the period of probation ordered WITHOUT buy out option.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy J Brickson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
